DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Propane is used strictly as machinery/equipment fuel

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Pacific Calcium Inc has had no releases or injuries from the use of Propane fuel for equipment. Leroy Rothrock and Steve Drexler as managers direct employees to have the utmost respect for Propane both in loading the tank and loading the equipment in addition to providing hazard awareness training. If there were an accidental release all personnel are instructed to evacuate the area immediately and call the Okanogan County Sheriff's Office and the Tonasket Fire Department - This is facilitated by being on the Emergency 911 System.
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT OUR FACILITY. This facility complies with the requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Tonasket Fire Department and the Okanogan County Emergency Response via the 911 Emergency Telephone number.
DESCRIPTION OF OUR FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES THERE. This facility is a quarry process plant. We process calcium carbonate and magnesium carbonate for use as soil amendments for sale to the public. We use propane as fuel for some of our equipment. The system consists of one 15,000 gallon propane tank which fuels our tractor loader and other equipment as needed.
WORST CASE SCENARIO. Our worst case scenario is failure of the 15,000 gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (88%@60 deg F) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. According to EPA's look-up tables, the distance to endpoint is 0.3 miles. There is one private home within that distance with a total population of 2 people. There is another private home just outside the boundary.
GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC STEPS. This facility complies with all applicable state and federal codes and regulations. The propane system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with State and Federal law.
FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY. We ha

ve never had an accident involving propane that caused deaths, injuries, property or envirnmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.
EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM. In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to contact the Tonasket Fire Department via the 911 Emergency number and request that they respond to the emergency. The Tonasket Fire Department is aware of the presence of the propane tank at the facility.
PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE THE SYSTEM. None
